name: European Skippers Organisation
membership:
Joint Nautical Technical Commission of the European Barge Union (EBU) and the European Skippers'Organisation (ESO);
Joint Commission Tanker Shipping & ADN of ESO and EBU (European Barge Union)
goal:
ESO looks after the interests of the European private inland shipping entrepreneurs on the European level. The ESO-Council is composed of representatives of Belgian, Dutch, French, German and Polish inland waterway transport organisations. Mr. Christiaan Van Lancker is the acting president.
Also an IWT organisation from Britain is admitted as associated member.

ESO is the interlocutor of the European Commission (DG-MOVE) and the Central Rhineshipping Committee (CCR) and participates in many working groups, which are often established on demand of ESO. Together with the colleages of the European Barge Union (EBU) a nautical-technical commission has been formed to advise the EC and CCR.

Since its etablishment ESO has occupied itself in the interest of independant entrepreneurs on various matters, such as market regulation, fleet renewal, use of reserve funds, market observation, waterway bottlenecks & infrastructure, inland shipping promotion, crew regulation, qualification and training, accommodation, environmental problems as degasing and waste disposal, River Information Services, sufficient berthing locations, etc.

In January 2014 ESO renewed its tanker shipping interests by establishing the Commission for Tanker shipping and ADN. This Commission is acknowledged by UNECE since January 2015.

From January 2016 ESO started with five additional internal policy commissions on the various fields. On the one hand to advise its Council and on the other hand to represent ESO in international institutions and organisations. Fields concerned are: infra, innovation & greening, social and educational affairs, nautical/technical affairs, market & economy. Each commission has its own president and secretary, chosen from the various memberorganisations and appointed by the council.
interests: Climate Action, Competition, Economic and Financial Affairs, Education, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enterprise, Environment, Internal Market, Regional Policy, Research and Technology, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives: amongst other: NAIADES / PLATINA implementation, Harmonisation of Qualification and Certification, Social  Dialogue on Working Time Agreement, Implementation of technical regulations, NRMM directive, measures on greening the fleet, market observation, application of financial instruments,
